title: SaxaVord Owes Contractors Money it Can’t Pay
summary:
Shetland Space Centre Limited owes approximately one million pounds to Shetland-based DITT Construction for the development of SaxaVord spaceport, two sources told European Spaceflight. The company currently does not have the funds to pay the amount after a £139 million debt facility promised by CEO Frank Strang in May failed to materialize. The construction of […]
The post SaxaVord Owes Contractors Money it Can’t Pay appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: China launches new-gen Haiyang ocean monitoring satellite
summary: China launched the first of a new series of Haiyang ocean observation satellites late Wednesday.

title: NASA exploration head Free to become associate administrator
summary: The head of NASA exploration programs will succeed a former astronaut as the agency’s third-highest official.

title: House Science Committee delays vote on commercial space bill
summary: The House Science Committee deferred a vote on a commercial space bill until after Thanksgiving amid opposition from committee Democrats about its provisions.
